review_title: Manageable Retail Management Position with Career Opportunities
pros:
-Growing and economically solid retail segment with strong upside well into the future.
-Compensation is above average (If you negotiate for it), bonus program is solid, stock bonus is good.
-Lots of room for growth in this company
-
cons:
stently challening with lots of room to show off personal talent and ideas. Corporate does not have a heavy hand, while they give lots of direction, you are free to make lots of decisions for the benefit of your store.
Cons
-ASM's shoulder a lot of responsibility and workload.
-Company is in a place of change. Some changes have been enormously helpful for the company but others have had detrimental effects at store level (ie, reliance on 3rd party services instead of in-house labor for certain jobs)
-Work/life balance can be tricky to maintain at this level
Advice to Management
-Strongly consider the impact of 3rd party programs that have been implemented over the last 12-18 months (Assembly, facility services, and delivery). While each store is going to have different experiences with the 3rd party vendors, most stores agree that these vendors have not added significant value at the store level. 
-The MST is wildly inconsistent. While some stores may have effective teams, many at my level view this team as underutilized and poorly managed.
-Even though there has been significant investment into Pro Services over the last year, I believe we are still not positioned to take meaningful market share away from competitors. We lack the infrastructure, partnerships, and staffing to do this. While the company will continue to roll-out new initiatives over the next few years, staffing at the store level has to be a key factor. Pro Services should have 50% more specialists and CSA's, a dedicated order pulling team, 1st party Pro delivery (Even if it is in the form of smaller footprint vehicles that can bring critical job materials within an hour. Ex, the auto parts delivery industry), and district level account managers.
